Articles.Content:
I thought that the person who answered the last riddle would get to make a new one, but oh well, I guess I will try to answer those first.

Starwhip's riddle is talking about a tree, but cziken20's riddle is a lot harder. Is it his lungs? A backpack? Any bodily organ?

Edited January 24, 2014 by Lord_Potato
A plant maybe?

You are right. It was so easy! Can i post another one? This one will be harder.

Here it is:

On a desert there is a dead human. He has an unopened bag. If he would open this bag he would be alive.

What is this bag?

This sounds like he's suffocated somehow, that there's something blocking his windpipe. "opening the bag", i.e., removing the blockage, could render him alive, assuming he is not too far gone. It's a little vague, really, it could be a number of things.
Not really a riddle... probably water.

More like a paradox. Why would he be dead if he had the water in the first place? Maybe there is a snake or something along with the water.

Try more lengthy riddles, like a certain someone on the forum.

EXAMPLE:

A fairly easy one:

Color of the earth,

Strong and stout,

Light, I cannot grow without.

I reach to the sky,

grasp the soil,

birds who fly through strife and toil

rest on my limbs through the night.

What am I?

Again, not very hard.

So, in order --

Brown.

Thick, strong.

Requires light to survive.

Relatively tall.

Has roots.

And provides nesting-places for birds.

It's a tree, but Lord_Potato already got it.

I can take a turn if you guys want, or otherwise I guess it's probably Lord_Potato's turn.

You are right. It was so easy! Can i post another one? This one will be harder.

Here it is:

On a desert there is a dead human. He has an unopened bag. If he would open this bag he would be alive.

What is this bag?

Any bag, if he'd open it himself he'd obviously be alive.
Well, it'd be hard for him to fit in most bags, so I guess it could more correctly be construed as a body bag...

I thought that the person who answered the last riddle would get to make a new one, but oh well, I guess I will try to answer those first.

Starwhip's riddle is talking about a tree, but cziken20's riddle is a lot harder. Is it his lungs? A backpack? Any bodily organ?

No. It's more... fluffy, and not-organic. (well it can be made of organic things but today's rather not.)

Any bag, if he'd open it himself he'd obviously be alive.

No. What's IN this bag? As above, it's not-organic.

Edited January 25, 2014 by cziken20
A body-bag?

A body-bag?

Nope. It's full of something, and it isn't connected itself with dying.

A waterskin? Water's not technically organic, going by the chemistry definitions of what an organic compound is.

A blanket?

The one that cziken found on Google was presumably this one:

What kills the bad ones and the sad ones tightens to fit so one size fits all?

The answer being a noose. And now I've seen that I can't unknow it, so I guess the game's up

sadly yes mine was that one ok

edit: ok back to the riddle it is probably a body bag or a bg that was put over the guys head to suffocate him or if the lungs count as a bag then the lungs

Edited January 26, 2014 by Helix935

A waterskin? Water's not technically organic, going by the chemistry definitions of what an organic compound is.

A blanket?

Nope.

sadly yes mine was that one ok

edit: ok back to the riddle it is probably a body bag or a bg that was put over the guys head to suffocate him or if the lungs count as a bag then the lungs

Nope.

You must do the thing like this: Nope

How about an animal of some sort for food.

You must do the thing like this: Nope

How about an animal of some sort for food.

NOPE! (hahaha)
Dis is not riddle. Dis be random question with no logical answer. Posteth again with a better riddle.

If ya give up, say so. Demandin' other things and degradin' the present riddler shan't be tolerated, laddie! Me, I'm giving up because I can't think enough at present. It's up to you whether you just let us know or wait till someone else gives up before posting the answer, cziken
If everybody gives up, i will give you the answer. But fist i will give a hint- it's small in the bag, but when taken of it's big, and it's thin.
Why would a tent save the guy?
It's not a tent...

I think i will post the answer. The answer is....

a parachute!

This makes no sense. I mean, it does make sense, but there is no connection between the desert and the parachute.

Can I have a go at this?

Since I was the one who got the riddle a while back ago, I should be the one to post a riddle, so here it is:

I am the question, I am the answer.

What am I?

This actually has two answers.

a parachute!
Y'know, that doesn't quite work... it could work with a few alterations, but you'd definitely have to mention something about him having fallen or whatever for it to really make sense.
Since I was the one who got the riddle a while back ago, I should be the one to post a riddle, so here it is:

I am the question, I am the answer.

What am I?

This actually has two answers.

It's too early for me to be awake. Call me in six hours and I'll think about this one.
A variable Ina math equation!

This makes no sense. I mean, it does make sense, but there is no connection between the desert and the parachute.

Can I have a go at this?

It doesn't matter that it is desert, i said desert to simply distract you.

Y'know, that doesn't quite work... it could work with a few alterations, but you'd definitely have to mention something about him having fallen or whatever for it to really make sense.

It's too early for me to be awake. Call me in six hours and I'll think about this one.

You know that if i would say that he fallen you would guess that right away?
